含义: The character '身' primarily means 'body' or 'oneself'. It can also refer to the main part of something, such as the trunk of a tree or the hull of a ship.
字形: The character '身' is a pictograph that resembles a human body. It consists of a vertical line representing the spine, with additional strokes depicting the torso and limbs.
读音: The pronunciation of '身' is 'shēn' in Mandarin Chinese.
字源: The character '身' originated from ancient pictographs that depicted a human body. Over time, it evolved into its current form, simplifying the strokes while retaining the overall shape of a body.

成语: 身不由己 (shēn bù yóu jǐ) - involuntarily
身临其境 (shēn lín qí jìng) - to be personally on the scene
身败名裂 (shēn bài míng liè) - to lose one's reputation and position
身先士卒 (shēn xiān shì zú) - to lead by example

她站在我身边。 (Tā zhàn zài wǒ shēn biān.) - She is standing by my side.
他身不由己地答应了。 (Tā shēn bù yóu jǐ de dā yìng le.) - He agreed involuntarily.
